meanings.definition: To surpass in fencing or fencing skill.
meanings.sent1: She managed to outfence her opponent with swift moves.
meanings.sent2: The fencing champion was able to outfence all his competitors.
meanings.sent3: In the fencing competition, she decided to outfence her rival by practicing diligently.
meanings.sent4: His ability to outfence his opponents made him a formidable competitor.
meanings.sent5: The fencer's determination to outfence everyone led to victory.

meanings.definition: To enclose or surround with a fence.
meanings.sent1: The farmer wanted to outfence his property to keep the animals safe.
meanings.sent2: They decided to outfence the garden to protect it from stray animals.
meanings.sent3: The neighbors joked that they would outfence their yard with flowers instead of a fence.
meanings.sent4: The wooden fence was meant to outfence the garden from any intruders.
meanings.sent5: The decision to outfence the area was to ensure privacy and security.

meanings.definition: To defend or protect with a fence.
meanings.sent1: The soldiers were ready to outfence the castle from any attacks.
meanings.sent2: The community worked together to outfence their town from potential dangers.
meanings.sent3: The family decided to outfence their backyard to keep their dog safe.
meanings.sent4: The goal was to outfence the property to create a safe space for children to play.
meanings.sent5: The fence was built to outfence the garden and shield it from strong winds.
